comments: Contribution from _Emeric Deutsch_, Feb 15 2010: (Start)a(n) is the number of binary words of length n that have no pair of adjacent 1's and have no 0000 subwords. Example: a(4)=7 because we have 0101, 1010, 0010, 1001, 0100, 0001, and 1000.a(n)=A171855(n,0). (End)

Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1, 0, 1).
formula: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-3) for n>3, see also A000930. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 26 2005For n>1, a(n) = 2*A000930(n) + A000930(n-2). [From _Gerald McGarvey_, Sep 10 2008]
